title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:

04:23 <jamesxu> Anyone can tell me how to write an xwiki servlet?  
04:23 <jamesxu> or is there any document?

06:57 <sdumitriu> has quit

11:20 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki

11:23 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
11:43 <+sburjan> tmortagne: awesome news. but also bad. I was able to reproduce the groovy macro issue on a 3.1 XEM  
11:44 <+sburjan> I will post a comment on the issue explaining step by step on how to reproduce  
11:44 <+tmortagne> sburjan: ok thanks, I will look at it then  
11:45 <+sburjan> let's get this fixed because it's getting on my nerves  
11:45 <+sburjan> writing now comment  
12:03 <woken> has quit  
12:10 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
12:29 <StefanM> has joined #xwiki  
12:30 <StefanM> has left #xwiki  
12:43 <abusenius> has quit  
12:46 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
12:59 <+sburjan> tmortagne: comment posted on XWIKI-6180 .That should suffice in order to be able to reproduce it.  
13:31 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
13:36 <qwebirc98840> has joined #xwiki  
13:42 <qwebirc98840> Hey Guys, I had asked this yesterday about adding default values to a TextArea Property in the Custom Display field and allowing it to be editable? Sorry for the repetitiveness but wasnt sure if anyone had responded to it.  Thank you for any assistance.  
13:46 <+tmortagne> sburjan: ok, thanks  
13:54 <+tmortagne> sburjan: according to the "Fix Version/s:", sdumitriu fixed XE-950 for 3.2M1 so it's probably expected that it's not fixed on 3.1  
13:56 <+sburjan> hm.. my bad. Could you close the issue ? because I tseted on 3.1, not on trunk  
13:56 <+tmortagne> sburjan: you don't have right to close it ?  
13:56 <+sburjan> and I will re-open it if the issue isn't fixed  
13:56 <+sburjan> shold I close as Fixed ?  
13:56 <+sburjan> \*should  
13:57 <+tmortagne> well that's what it was before you reopen it, right ?  
13:57 <+sburjan> yes  
13:57 <+tmortagne> so yes close it as fixed if it's fixed ;)  
14:47 <+tmortagne> sburjan: good news, I can reproduce with your instructions, should be quickly fixed  
14:47 <+sburjan> tmortagne: cool. is it hard to fix ? I am curious about what was wrong  
14:48 <+tmortagne> there is something wrong in the way right is tested for existing macros at startup but I will need to look at it in debug mode to find out what exactly, you probably found a bug in the right service itself  
14:48 <+sburjan> anyway.. it seems to affect from 2.7 -> 3.1 .. so we should also commit on 3.0 branch because it is still maintained  
14:49 <+tmortagne> yea about that we need to release 3.0.1 and get rid of this branch  
14:49 <+sburjan> I see, well.. glad I was able to reproduce it and now it's gonna be fixed  
14:49 <+sburjan> well... I guess there will be a 3.0.2 also .. so dunno if we're getting rid of it so fast  
14:51 <+tmortagne> sburjan: we released 3.1 so the stable branch is now 3.1, whatever is found after 3.0.1 is released there will be no 3.0.2 version  
14:51 <+tmortagne> 3.0.1 release is just late  
14:52 <+sburjan> well.. you know better. but we had 2.7.2.. I guess we will have also 3.0.2  
14:52 <+tmortagne> it has nothing to do with the version  
14:52 <+tmortagne> 2.7.1 was released before 3.0 was released  
14:53 <+tmortagne> and there was fixed things after it so we released them in a 2.7.2  
14:53 <+tmortagne> we are not stoping to support a branch when there is a x.x.2  
14:53 <+tmortagne> we are stopping when the next major version has been released  
14:53 <+tmortagne> but again 3.0.1 is just late and was planned already before 3.1  
14:54 <+sburjan> ok, you know better.  
15:17 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
15:21 <+tmortagne> sburjan: FYI it's indeed a bug in right system itself  
15:21 <+sburjan> i guess it's good we found it.. who know what other stuff could trigger on a wiki  
15:21 <+tmortagne> yep  
15:22 <+tmortagne> at least this bug restraint right, it should not add more  
15:26 <+sburjan> yes ...  
15:35 <+evalica> incubator.myxwiki.org is down - is there any sys admin who can take care of this?  
15:42 <+mflorea> tmortagne: where is the xwiki log written now? I can't find it under jetty, nor under tmp and neither under the home folder.  
15:44 <+tmortagne> mflorea: on jetty I have no idea, it did not changed for tomcat  
15:44 <+tmortagne> (I never use jetty)  
15:44 <+tmortagne> you still have it on the console ?  
15:45 <+mflorea> I'm trying to find the (full) log on the ci agent  
15:45 <+tmortagne> ha  
15:45 <+mflorea> I know I can see it on the web interface  
15:46 <+tmortagne> sorry I don't know about file log in jetty, even when I use it I usually only look at console output  
15:46 <+mflorea> ok  
15:46 <+mflorea> I'll keep searching  
15:48 <+mflorea> the issue is that tests hand in agent 1 and 2, and it always happens when running ui-tests but there is nothing logged in the console (at least from what I can see in the web UI) to indicate the problem. More over I can wget pages when logged on the agent so XE is running but selenium tests are not executed  
15:48 <+mflorea> s/hand/hang  
15:50 <+tmortagne> mflorea: it probably mean the problem is in test itself  
15:51 <+tmortagne> especially if you can navigate XE  
15:51 <+tmortagne> so i doubt you will learn what's wrong from XE log  
15:51 <+mflorea> the issue is that from the log I can't tell which test is rnning  
15:52 <+mflorea> selenium tests and wysiwyg tests log the test name on the console  
15:52 <+tmortagne> could you give be the link to the log ?  
15:52 <+mflorea> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests-3.1/246/consoleFull  
15:53 <+tmortagne> thanks  
15:53 <+mflorea> lots of loginsubmit requests  
15:54 <+tmortagne> indeed looks like we lost ui test logs  
15:55 <+tmortagne> that itself seems wrong to be  
15:55 <+mflorea> if you scroll up  from the bottom you can see "Running org.xwiki.test.ui.AllTests"  
15:55 <+tmortagne> yes but we are supposed to have detailed log of what is done by the test AFAIK  
15:56 <+tmortagne> what test is running etc.  
15:56 <+mflorea> I don't know. I usually run ui-tests from eclipse so I didn't notice the log  
15:56 <+mflorea> but I know for sure that selenium-tests and wysiwyg-tests have a more detailed log  
15:59 <+tmortagne> maybe I actually remember it like if it was th same as selenium1 tests  
15:59 <+tmortagne> but then we should enabled it  
15:59 <+tmortagne> otherwise it's very hard to know where is the issue  
16:00 <+tmortagne> if not impossible  
16:00 <+mflorea> yes  
16:01 <+tmortagne> a pity http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests-3.1/ws/xwiki-enterprise-test/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/target/surefire-reports/org.xwiki.test.ui.AllTests.txt is not filled during test  
16:01 <+mflorea> yep, I looked there too  
16:03 <+tmortagne> hmm there is something wrong with rendering tests, jenkins indicate that they are not executed  
16:03 <+tmortagne> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-rendering/275/  
16:03 <+tmortagne> chekcing if it's really true, maybe the display is wrong  
16:04 <+tmortagne> since running test require a profile  
16:05 <+tmortagne> it's ok, I can see it's executed  
16:18 <Spazholio> I'm currently using the following in a panel: "#set($bookmarks = "$xwiki.getUserPreference('bookmarks')")"  It seems to return the "bookmark" preference (which is a textbox, identical to the Address preference) for the user just fine, but the formatting is a little weird whenever I have a wikilink in there.  Any ideas why that is, or is there something I can do about it?  I'm thinking maybe the textbox is saving the info formatted, and then the .get  
16:18 <Spazholio> http://pastebin.com/e6wdAE9W  <-- example of what I see in the panel's source  
16:19 <+Denis> mflorea: thanks for having try anyway, for sure my user has, so it could happen again. Have you seen my recent XWIKI-6754 ? have you any comments in regards to the WYSIWYG editor, in particular for livetable that I should know about while fixing this ?  
16:22 <+mflorea> let me check  
16:32 <+mflorea> Denis: WYSIWYG editor code is \*not\* loaded deferred (check the wysiwyg\_import velocity macro from macros.vm) and also it doesn't listen to xwiki:dom:loaded event (it has its own mechanism to detect when the code is available, Wysiwyg.onModuleLoad(someFunction) ). So I don't think XWIKI-6754 affects the WYSIWYG editor.  
16:36 <mflorea> has quit

17:35 <Enygma`> has quit  
17:40 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
17:43 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
18:14 <qwebirc98840> Can anyone help with getting field validation setup? I have checked out the tutorial but still cant get just basic validation check and message to appear. Any suggestions?  
18:20 <@cjdelisle> what type of field validation are you using?  
18:27 <+Enygma`> Does anyone know why we are doing https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-administration/src/main/resources/XWiki/AdminRightsSheet.xml instead of just pasting the content of rightsUI.vm inside XWiki.AdminRightsSheet?  
18:29 <+tmortagne> Enygma`: not really no, I guess it used to be possible to access right UI directly as template (maybe it's till possible) and duplication is always bad  
18:29 <qwebirc98840> @cjdelisle: sorry, im relatively new to all this..what do mean what type?  
18:29 <@cjdelisle> can you link to the howto which you are using? There are a couple ways to do validation.  
18:33 <+evalica> can someone restart the incubator.myxwiki.org?  
18:33 <qwebirc98840> @cjdelisle: Yes, i believe so. In the class I just want to define with a regex, say for someone to follow a specific format for ID, and the message to appear when they try to save and its not valid  
18:34 <qwebirc98840> @cjdelisle: seems like something simple, like $doc.validate() should activate it, but im obviously missing something or several things.  
18:35 <@cjdelisle> So you have a regex and it still allows users to type things in when editing the page which they should not?  
18:36 <qwebirc98840> correct  
18:37 <@cjdelisle> I think the post form is supposed to have a hidden field which submits validate=1 when the user clicks save  
18:37 <@cjdelisle> do you have the link to the tutorial?  
18:39 <qwebirc98840> yes, http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Creating+a+form+with+validation+and+tooltips  
18:39 <qwebirc98840> but if i add in the <input type="hidden" name="xvalidate" value="1" />, it dosn't read it correctly with syntax 2.0  
18:41 <@cjdelisle> try {{html clean="false"}}<input type="hidden" name="xvalidate" value="1" />{{/html}}  
18:44 <qwebirc98840> Okay, tried that..and now its just not allowing you to save the new page created using that class? Strange  
18:46 <@cjdelisle> I should mention that you are using a very old method of validation which is not much used anymore.  
18:47 <qwebirc98840> ahh okay so it is working.  
18:47 <qwebirc98840> lol can you tell me of a better method then?  
18:48 <qwebirc98840> it is working but just does not allow it to be saved if incorrect, but no Error Message appears.  
18:48 <qwebirc98840> A newer way would be helpful, definitely.  
18:49 <@cjdelisle> The way XWiki.Registration does it is to let the user type into a form which it creates then it uses script to validate it.  
18:50 <@cjdelisle> It's reasonably modular too so you could probably just go ahead and copy/paste it to make yourself a form.  
18:56 <tekzilla> has quit  
18:56 <qwebirc98840> Okay im looking at the registration code... ill let you know if i can figure it all out :)  
18:57 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
18:58 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
19:00 <Spazholio> Is there any way for me to preserve line breaks in a panel?  The info is entered via the WYSIWYG, and if it's displayed anywhere else, it's correct but in a panel, it strips the linebreaks.  
19:01 <@cjdelisle> try using enter twice instead of once  
19:02 <Spazholio> No go.  Still strips them.  
19:02 <@cjdelisle> I'm not sure on that one.  
19:04 <Spazholio> Rats.  Thanks for the attempt.  
19:16 <arkub> has quit  
19:19 <Spazholio> Anyone else have any ideas?  
19:20 <evalica> has quit  
19:20 <qwebirc98840> is there something thats a more simple model than the xwiki.Registration?  
19:21 <Enygma`> has quit  
19:25 <jvdrean> has quit  
19:25 <qwebirc98840> maybe a validation example that doesn't have all user login/permissions requirements?
